intro: Parnassia alpicola, commonly known as the alpine parnassia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, often in moist, rocky soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant is often found in mountainous areas of Europe and Asia. Parnassia alpicola is adapted to cold climates and is often associated with high-altitude ecosystems.
